li.a: Jr./Sr. High School - Activities - Fort Kearny Conference

span.span: As you know, graduation for this year is scheduled for Saturday, May 9th. Despite our best efforts to try to plan a ceremony on May 9th that followed social distancing guidelines, the Directed Health Measure that was signed last week forced us to reconsider our plans.

After much discussion with the Senior Class, we have made the decision to postpone our graduation ceremony to Saturday, June 27th at 11:00 a.m. Our hope is that on June 27th we will be able to have a traditional graduation ceremony in our gym. However, if that is not possible, we will have a social-distancing “drive-in” style ceremony. And, if that is impossible due to health restrictions, we will celebrate our Seniors with a virtual graduation ceremony.
Whatever the case, it is our goal to honor our Seniors in the best way that we can. This is a special occasion for them, and we want to preserve the tradition of graduation as much as possible.

So, as we move closer to June 27th, we will keep you informed as to the type of graduation ceremony we will be having. Until then, we will hold out hope that we can all celebrate together with the Class of 2020 on June 27th.
We in the Ansley School District are committed to our students.

div.p: Are you looking for something to do? Are you bored because you miss school SO much? Do you wish you had a clever way to interact with your friends you haven't seen?
Parents, do you need something to do with your kids? Or do you need something for you kids to do.....over there.......away from you.........maybe in a different room or outside?
Well look no further. But....keep looking down this page.....like, there's a video you will need to look at, so.....I guess just look a little further, but that is it. Then don't look anymore.

We at the Ansley Institute of Fun and Games, have come up with a way to keep us all connected, but still apart. It is called Ansley Taskmaster. Loosley based on an English television show, Ansley Taskmaster will present a simple task for individuals, groups, or families to solve in clever ways. Each task will be solved in the form of a 30 second or less video that will be uploaded to Flipgrid, a free app that allows people to post their video, and look at how other individuals or groups solved the task in different ways. There's no right way to solve these tasks, and the fun is seeing how other people have found their solutions in their own ways. At the end of the week, a group of selected people will find the person or family that has the best video and award a prize.
Flip Grid is free, but will require an account. All of the students have an email that will allow them to create an acoount easily. Their email is firstnamelastname@ansleyps.org
For example: georgewashington@ansleyps.org - (not a real student)
Passwords for the elementary will be set at a default setting that can be changed via a page on the school webpage.
Junior High and high school may have changed theirs already.
If you need a password for your student's account, call the school or email Mr. Olson at tolson@ansleyps.org
The link is:

Once you click on this link and get an account, adding videos is simple. Just click on the Green + sign and allow Flip Grid to use your camera and microphone. You can then shoot your video. Don't like it? Trash it and start over. When you get one that is satisfactory, add your name and selfie and it will be loaded with everyone else's. You can even shoot and edit video in clips, or make a video with Imovie or some other app and upload your 30 second or less video to Flip Grid.
Everyone in the Ansley School Community is invited to participate. It is easy to do. And a good way to keep in touch with your friends and neighbors.
We want as many entries as we can get, so if you have a family of four, come up with four different ideas if you want. Or do one as a family, either way is great.
If you have any issues at all, call the school or email Mr. Olson and we will get it figured out. Hopefully we have covered the important parts and we can figure out the rest.
Watch the video to see two people ramble through an otherwise simple explanation of this whole process.

div.p: As many of you have already heard, the Governor has moved to close all schools in Nebraska for the remainder of the school year. We are deeply saddened by this news. Remote learning will continue, and we will keep you informed as we work out other details regarding this closure. Thank you for your continued support of our students and staff.
#ansleyproud

span.span: At this time, we are asking anyone with a child interested in playing summer ball to fill out this form. We are trying to gather names and get a head count of players interested. If you are in PreK-12th grade, we want to be able to find a team for you!

It is unclear what our season will entail with the uncertainty of our current situation, so at this time please do not send any money with the return of these forms. If restrictions are lifted and the season is able to be played, then we will gather fees at that time. We will pray and hope for the best that life can get back to normal soon.

span.b: PARENTS: Coaches are needed. If you are willing to coach, please volunteer. We are also needing volunteers for umping behind the plate and in the outfield at home games.

b.u: PLEASE RETURN TO SCHOOL OFFICE with your students homework packets on Monday, March 30, as well as sending a
screenshot of the completed form to League Representative, Donna Hoblyn-Bittner at 308-870-0883 or email it to

span.span: In return for my child (Participant) being allowed to participate in the Spartan Youth Activities Organization (the Program) I release and agree not to sue the program, its members, and their employees, sub-contractors, sponsors, agents, and affiliates from all present and future claims that may be made by the Participant or me, my family, estate, heirs, or assigns for property damage, personal injury, or wrongful death arising as a result of the Participants participation in the Program, and caused by the ordinary negligence of the parties listed above, wherever, whenever, or however the same may occur. I understand and agree that those listed above are not responsible for any injury or property damage arising about of the Program, even if caused by their ordinary negligence. I understand that participation in the Program involves certain risks, including, but not limited to serious injury. I am voluntarily allowing Participant to participate in the Program with knowledge of the danger involved and agree to accept all risks of such participation. I certify that the participant is in excellent physical health and may participate in strenuous and hazardous physical activities to be played in the Program. Permission is granted for participant to receive emergency medical treatment, if needed. I also agree to indemnify and hold harmless those listed above for all claims arising out of Participants participation in the Program and all related activities. I am the parent or legal guardian of the Participant. I am of legal age and am freely signing this agreement. I have read this form and understand that by signing this form, I am giving up legal rights and remedies. I represent that I am parent/legal guardian of the child named above and agree that the terms of this release are binding on me and the Participant. Liability Clause: I/we the Parents/legal Guardian of the above-named Participant in the Spartan Youth Activities Organization hereby give my/our approval to their participation in any and all activities during the season. I/We assume all risks and hazards incidental to such participation, including transportation to and from all activities. I/We hereby waive, release, absolve, indemnify and agree to hold harmless the Spartan Youth Activities Organization, its organizers, sponsors, supervisors, board members, and other participants.
